commit 84477cce6227242653cefdb126da238143117e77

    Return a lockout/cooldown if reading the table fails.
    
    When the select sql statement fails, return an unexpired
    lockout/cooldown to treat it as in lockout/cooldown, instead of
    returning std::nullopt which indicates no lockout/cooldown. This should
    happen rarely (?), but just to behave on the cautious side.
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6344020

M	content/browser/interest_group/interest_group_storage.cc

commit c0814d272352f88012cab6110626c37f704254eb

    Ensure Long-Press Menu Does Not Exceed Screen Width
    
    This CL updates the long-press menu to prevent it from exceeding the screen width. It also fixes a bug where the menu remains on the screen after a screen rotation, which could cause it to appear in unexpected locations.
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6344816

commit ebecc735631673260f5386dbf543cb1a127e306a

    android: Improve output of nullaway stats
    
    Sorting the deps that are ready to be worked on makes it easier to see
    what needs to be done in each segment of code. Also default to out/Debug
    for output directory.
    
    Example output (truncated):
    $ tools/android/nullaway/class_and_target_stats.py -C out/Debug
    [ 5] android_webview/js_sandbox:js_sandbox_service_java
    [ 3] android_webview/nonembedded:crash_java
    [ 1] android_webview/nonembedded:util_java
    [ 2] android_webview/support_library/boundary_interfaces:boundary_interface_java
    [ 1] android_webview/tools/sdk_sandbox:sdk_sandbox_webview_client_java
    [ 1] android_webview/tools/sdk_sandbox:sdk_sandbox_webview_sdk
    [ 1] build/android/pylib/device/commands:unzip_java
    [ 1] build/android/stacktrace:java_deobfuscate_java
    [ 1] chrome/android/features/dev_ui:java
    [ 1] chrome/android/modules/stack_unwinder/internal:java
    [ 1] chrome/android/webapk/libs/runtime_library:webapk_service_aidl_java
    [ 1] chrome/android/webapk/shell_apk:compiled_in_runtime_library_java
    [24] chrome/android/webapk/shell_apk:h2o_j_unit_webapk_generated_webapk_java
    [24] chrome/android/webapk/shell_apk:unbound_webapk_generated_webapk_java
    [24] chrome/android/webapk/shell_apk:webapk_chromeos_generated_webapk_java
    
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6348480

M	tools/android/nullaway/class_and_target_stats.py

commit 4d095641e533599b53c45d8639a35fceadbc08a8

    Reland "fail if rbe_exec_root is set with use_siso=true"
    
    This reverts commit 97b7fd5eb389b0aa0cca1410165778148fcb94d8.
    
    Reason for revert:
    unsafe_buffers_paths.txt is only used when
    clang_use_chrome_plugins == true,
    so no need to add rewrapper `-inputs=`
    if clang_use_chrome_plugins == false.
    
    Original change's description:
    > Revert "fail if rbe_exec_root is set with use_siso=true"
    >
    > This reverts commit 9436c1142c5404ffd24be354c289c0a9064abb76.
    >
    > Reason for revert: break ChromeOS builders b/402483181
    >
    > Original change's description:
    > > fail if rbe_exec_root is set with use_siso=true
    > >
    > > Siso doesn't handle rbe_exec_root.
    > >
    >
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6345112

M	build/config/BUILDCONFIG.gn
M	build/config/clang/clang.gni
M	build/toolchain/rbe.gni

commit c7debf96ebebaf6b50e8a90e23c15ee66c2e967f

    Disable DevTools remote debugging for default user data dir
    
    With this CL, on Linux, Windows, macOS if a default user data dir is
    being used then the remote debugging server no longer starts but emits
    an error message to stderr.
    
    A feature DevToolsDebuggingRestrictions is added to control this
    behavior that is enabled by default for Google Chrome builds but could
    be used to disable the protection if widespread incompatibilities are
    encountered.
    
    As part of this CL, the enterprise policy message to stderr is now only
    shown if remote debugging is requested.
    
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6311292

M	chrome/browser/browser_process_impl.cc
M	chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browsertest.cc

commit 89caa0b7c8e45b3d8b6011becde8adda8c126b08

    [tvOS] Adapt to "[ios blink] Use BELayerHierarchy for passing surfaces"
    
    Also known as https://crrev.com/c/6254053, which introduced a code path
    dependent on BrowserEngineKit for iOS in some classes used by tvOS, like
    ImageTransportSurfaceOverlayMac and CALayerFrameSinkProvider.
    
    Try to disrupt the existing iOS code as little as possible while making
    tvOS work again by:
    
    - Adding some ifdefs and corresponding GN checks around BrowserEngineKit
      APIs and includes.
    - Making tvOS use the previous RWHV<->CALayerFrameSinkProvider code path
      by subclassing RenderWidgetHostViewIOS and making UpdateCALayerTree()
      use ui::DisplayCALayerTree.
    - Making CALayerFrameSinkProvider build without BrowserEngineKit again
      by varying its parent class depending on whether we are building for
      iOS or tvOS.
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6343678

M	content/browser/BUILD.gn
A	content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_tvos.h
A	content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_tvos.mm
M	content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_view_ios.mm
M	gpu/ipc/common/BUILD.gn
M	gpu/ipc/service/image_transport_surface_overlay_mac.h
M	gpu/ipc/service/image_transport_surface_overlay_mac.mm
M	ui/accelerated_widget_mac/BUILD.gn
M	ui/accelerated_widget_mac/ca_layer_frame_sink_provider.h
electron-build-tools_gitLog:
commit 59a246e8689e2eb1705f1970472491e092e94818

    Output "DCHECK failed" for DCHECK() failures
    
    This lets us distinguish between CHECK() and DCHECK() failures in logs.
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6238477

commit ce41a1e988c20274ffbb57c9a37d81bbde998ad8

    Push non-official CHECK_op failures into lambda
    
    This is a reland of crrev.com/c/6097359 which is hypothesized to have
    been reverted due to false-positive MSan errors in ScreenAI which are
    believed to be fixed in crrev.com/c/6197662. Worth another shot at
    least.
    
    This seems to generate significantly better code in hot spots, likely
    because most of the failure path can get out-of-lined by the compiler
    (which lets it inline the fast/hot path and dead-code eliminate more).
    
    This also intends to out-of-line the "foo < bar" string from in the hot
    spot of a CHECK_op macro which hopefully means less parameter passing.
    
    Performance testing from crrev.com/c/6324721 yields significant improvements (covers most, not all, of the gap to CHECK() as tested in
    crrev.com/c/6337444):
    
    Before:
    
    Baseline: 3896 runs/s.
    Span indexing: 782 runs/s.
    Ranged-based foreach: 549 runs/s.
    Foreach algo: 619 runs/s.
    Transform algo: 353 runs/s.
    
    After:
    
    Baseline: 3932 runs/s.
    Span indexing: 3449 runs/s.
    Ranged-based foreach: 1111 runs/s.
    Foreach algo: 1151 runs/s.
    Transform algo: 954 runs/s.
    
    Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6346013
